question: [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/blstrs/fft.rs] [Function: All FFT functions] [Domain sharing] If multiple threads share the same EvaluationDomain but operate on different polynomials, can accessing dom fields cause race conditions? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/blstrs/fft.rs] [Function: serial_fft_assign] [In-place modification races] Can interruption during in-place FFT computation leave the array in an inconsistent state if the validator node crashes mid-operation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/blstrs/fft.rs] [Function: fft_assign] [Polynomial commitment integration] Can incorrect FFT results cause polynomial commitments used in validator signatures to fail verification, disrupting consensus? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/blstrs/fft.rs] [Function: ifft_assign] [Secret sharing reconstruction] If IFFT is used to reconstruct secret-shared validator keys, can mathematical errors cause key reconstruction failures halting consensus? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/blstrs/fft.rs] [Function: All FFT functions] [VRF integration] If FFT operations are used in VRF randomness generation for leader election, can errors cause predictable or biased leader selection? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/blstrs/fft.rs] [Function: serial_fft_assign_g1/g2] [BLS signature aggregation] Can incorrect FFT in G1/G2 break BLS signature aggregation used for quorum certificates, preventing consensus progress? (Critical)
